sentence.Network_en: The Sioux had always fought other tribes for territorial rights.
sentence.Network_cn: 苏人总是为领地权与其他部落作战。

sentence.Network_en: They battled against other Indian tribes, but rarely fought with the whites.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们同其他印第安部落作战，但很少与白人并肩对敌。

sentence.Network_en: Many African tribes believe in reincarnation.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多非洲的部落都相信人会转世。

PerfectNetExp.abs: From the mountains , the tribes of Mongols have came to help their friends - Khergits ., 从山区 , 各部落的蒙古人都来帮助他们的朋友 -Khergits.
A member of any of the predominantly Moslem Malay tribes of the southern Philippines ., 摩洛人在南部菲律宾的主要的穆斯林部落中的一员.

since the Stargazers' secession from the Garou Nation , all newly Changed Stargazer cubs have been given their Rites of Passage away from the other tribes .在Stargazer脱离了狼人一族以后，所有的重新生活的Stargazer幼兽开始在远离其他部族的地方举行他们的成年典礼。

entry.tran: (尤指发展中国家的)部落，部族(一些人不赞成此用法)
entry.def: Tribe is sometimes used to refer to a group of people of the same race, language, and customs, especially in a developing country. Some people disapprove of this use.

example.ex: …a map of Maryland marked with the names of Indian tribes.
example.tran: 标有印第安部落名称的马里兰州地图

entry.tran: (从事相同活动或行为相同的)一伙(人)，一帮(人)
entry.def: You can use tribe to refer to a group of people who are all doing the same thing or who all behave in the same way.

example.tran: 一群群才华出众的年轻人

example.ex: …the particularly unpleasant tribe who argue over the splitting of restaurant and bar bills.
example.tran: 那帮为分摊吃喝账单而争吵的令人非常讨厌的家伙
